main event: A UFO sighting was reported on February 19th, 1958 in Sweet Springs, Missouri, involving sightings of a metallic object with red flame and grey smoke, followed by its rapid descent without any evidence of a crash.
interesting points: The object was silver in color, bullet-shaped, estimated to be 20 feet long, and 4 to 5 feet in diameter, with witnesses describing it as resembling an airplane without wings.
The object was reported to have left no contrail, dissipated smoke rapidly, and fell straight down without oscillating or tumbling.
The witnesses launched a ground search and conducted aerial surveillance of the area, but no physical evidence of a crash was found.
The document includes handwritten and typed reports from Project Blue Book, as well as testimonies from civilian and military personnel.
The sighting was described by a reliable witness and was investigated by troopers, with interviews confirming the credibility of the witness.
sighted object: a metallic object with red flame and grey smoke
